meanings.definition: A person who breaks or fractures something.
meanings.sent1: The young boy was known as the best fracturers in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The fracturers at the construction site were skilled in demolishing old buildings.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy fracturers at the pottery class accidentally shattered all the vases.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like it was in the hands of a merciless fracturer, breaking it into pieces.
meanings.sent5: The fracturers in the earthquake left behind a trail of destruction and chaos.

meanings.definition: The act of breaking or fracturing something.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise signaled the fracturers of the glass window.
meanings.sent2: The fracturers of the rocks echoed through the canyon.
meanings.sent3: The fracturers of the silence with their laughter made the library lively.
meanings.sent4: The fracturers of tradition paved the way for new ideas to flourish.
meanings.sent5: The fracturers of the ice created a mesmerizing pattern on the frozen lake.
